Class Motorcycle

java.lang.Object
com.gradescope.datastructures.Vehicle
com.gradescope.datastructures.Motorcycle
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Vehicle>
public class Motorcycle extends Vehicle
Represents a Motorcycle vehicle.

A Motorcycle is a concrete subclass of Vehicle with a specific horsepower constraint and an optional sidecar feature.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

  • Constructor Details

    • Motorcycle

      public Motorcycle(double price, int hp, double miles, boolean sidecar)
      Constructs a Motorcycle with the specified attributes.
      Parameters:
      price - the price of the motorcycle (validated in Vehicle)
      hp - the horsepower (must be either 50 or 75)
      miles - the mileage of the motorcycle (validated in Vehicle)
      sidecar - whether the motorcycle has a sidecar
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if horsepower is invalid

  • Method Details

    • setHorsepower

      public void setHorsepower(int hp)
      Sets the horsepower for the motorcycle.

      Valid horsepower values are 50 or 75 only.

      Specified by:
      setHorsepower in class Vehicle
      Parameters:
      hp - the horsepower to set
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if hp is not 50 or 75

    • hasSidecar

      public boolean hasSidecar()
      Returns whether this motorcycle has a sidecar.
      Returns:
      true if the motorcycle has a sidecar, false otherwise

    • setSidecar

      public void setSidecar(boolean sidecar)
      Sets whether this motorcycle has a sidecar.
      Parameters:
      sidecar - true to attach a sidecar, false otherwise

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a formatted string representation of this Motorcycle.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string describing the motorcycle's price, horsepower, mileage, and sidecar status
